isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - DISASSEMBLE - THIRTEEN-SPEED TRANSMISSIONS

figure.caption: Figure 133. Thirteen-Speed Transmission

step1.para: Put the auxiliary cover in a holding fixture, such as an axle repair stand.
Remove the bolts and washers that fasten the piston housing cover to the auxiliary cover. Remove the cover and gasket. If necessary, remove the fitting and shuttle valve from the cover (Figure 134).
Remove the nuts and washers that fasten the pistons to the shift shafts. Discard the nut (Figure 134).

figure.caption: Figure 134. Remove Piston Housing Cover

step1.para: Remove the piston housing and the pistons as an assembly. Inspect the O-rings on the pistons. Replace worn or damaged O-rings (Figure 135).

figure.caption: Figure 135. Remove Piston Housing and Pistons

step1.para: Use a scraper to remove the gasket material from between the cover and housing.
Inspect the O-rings in the shaft bores of the piston housing. If worn or damaged, replace the O-rings (Figure 136).

figure.caption: Figure 136. Inspect O-Rings

step1.para: Remove the mounting bolts and washers from the output bearing retainer. Remove the retainer. Use a scraper to remove the gasket material. Remove the speedometer gear from the shaft.
Inspect the oil seal in the output bearing retainer. If the seal is worn or damaged, remove and replace the seal ( Figure 137).
If a mechanical speedometer is used, inspect the speedometer bushing inside the output bearing retainer. If worn or damaged, remove the bushing (Figure 137).

figure.caption: Figure 137. Inspect Oil Seal and Speedometer Bushing

step1.para: Move the assembly in the repair stand so that the inside of the cover is toward you.

note.para: If a pin and clip is used to fasten the HI-LO fork to the shift shaft, replace with a nut and shoulder bolt during assembly.

step1.para: Remove the shoulder bolt and nut (or pin and clip) that fastens the HI-LO fork to the shift shaft (Figure 138).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Remove Shoulder Bolt and Nut

warning.para: When using a hammer and a steel drift, wear safe eye protection and make sure the tools are in safe condition. Do not use tools that are worn or damaged (mushroomed). If the tools are not in safe condition, pieces can break and cause serious personal injury.

step1.para: If necessary, use a hammer and brass drift to remove the shift shaft from the HI-LO fork ( Figure 139).
Remove the HI-LO fork from the synchronizer collar ( Figure 139).

figure.caption: Figure 139. Remove Shift Shaft and HI-LO Fork

note.para: Install a bolt to fasten the plate to the cover to keep the gears from moving when the nut is removed ( Figure 140).

figure.caption: Figure 140. Install Bolt to Fasten Plate to Cover

step1.para: Remove and discard the nut and washer that fasten the LO gear and synchronizer assembly to the output shaft (Figure 141).

figure.caption: Figure 141. Remove and Discard Nut and Washer

step1.para: Remove the bolts and washers that fasten the holding plates on the countershafts and cover. DO NOT CHANGE THE POSITION OF THE AUXILIARY COVER IN THE REPAIR STAND. Remove the holding plates (Figure 140).

On Design Level 1 Transmission, remove the snap rings that fasten the upper and lower auxiliary countershafts in the cover. Remove the rear bearing cups. DO NOT CHANGE THE POSITION OF THE COVER IN THE REPAIR STAND (Figure 142).

figure.caption: Figure 142. Remove Snap Rings and Rear Bearing Cups

step1.para: Move the splitter shaft so that the splitter fork will not touch the LO gear during removal.
Move each countershaft away from the LO gear.
Remove the LO gear and synchronizer assembly (Figure 143).

figure.caption: Figure 143. Remove LO Gear and Synchronizer Assembly

step1.para: Remove the splitter fork and shaft assembly and the clutch collar as an assembly (Figure 144).
Remove the upper and lower auxiliary countershafts from the cover (Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Remove Splitter Fork and Shaft Assembly, and Upper and Lower Auxiliary Countershafts

step1.para: Remove the low synchronizer assembly from the LO gear assembly (Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Remove Low Synchronizer Assembly

step1.para: Remove the snap ring and washer that fasten the LO gear on the coupling. Remove the thrust washer and coupling (Figure 146).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Remove Thrust Washer and Coupling

step1.para: If necessary, disassemble the splitter fork and shaft assembly ( Figure 147).

figure.caption: Figure 147. If Necessary, Disassemble Splitter Fork and Shaft Assembly

step1.para: Use a puller to remove the front cone from the upper and lower auxiliary countershafts. Make sure the jaws of the puller are under the bearing races (Figure 148).

figure.caption: Figure 148. Remove Front Cone

step1.para: Support the splitter gear in a press so that the rear cone is toward the top of the press. Put a sleeve on the countershaft. Press the countershaft from the cone and gear. Remove the key from the countershaft (Figure 149).

figure.caption: Figure 149. Press Countershaft From Cone and Gear

step1.para: Support the auxiliary cover in a press. Make sure the output shaft is toward the top of the press ( Figure 150).

figure.caption: Figure 150. Support Auxiliary Cover in a Press

step1.para: Put a sleeve on the top of the output shaft. Press the output shaft and OD gear assembly from the cover.
Remove the outer bearing cone from the cover.
Support the case on a press. Make sure the inner surface of the case is toward the top of the press ( Figure 151).

figure.caption: Figure 151. Support Case on a Press

step1.para: Put a sleeve on the outer race of the outer bearing cap.
Press the inner and outer cups from the cover. Discard the cups.
Remove the spacer from the shaft (Figure 152).

figure.caption: Figure 152. Remove Spacer From Shaft

step1.para: Support the assembly in the press by the gear. Make sure the threads are toward the top of the press.
Put a sleeve on top of the output shaft. Press the shaft out of the cone and gear. Discard the cone ( Figure 153).

figure.caption: Figure 153. Press Shaft Out of Cone and Gear

step1.para: Remove the spacer from the output shaft (Figure 154).
Inspect all parts. Refer to CLEAN AND INSPECT section.

figure.caption: Figure 154. Remove Spacer From Output Shaft
